appian.com   |    13
Our investors.
After 18 years in business, Appian became a public company 
in May 2017, with an opening share price of $12. At the close 
of 2020, the value of Appian shares was 900 percent higher 
than at the time of our IPO (Initial Public Offering), yielding 
early shareholders a remarkable return on investment.
Early last year, Appian announced the acquisition of Novayre 
Solutions SL, based in Barcelona, Spain, developer of the Jidoka robotic process automation (RPA) platform. That 
acquisition made Appian a one-stop shop for automation, 
with best-in-class solutions for workflow, artificial intelligence 
(AI), and RPA. Forrester expects the RPA services market to 
reach $12 billion by 2023, according to a recent report. With 
our Novayre Solutions acquisition, Appian is well positioned to 
compete and win in the RPA marketplace.
Appian continues to increase 
revenue, which rose by 
17 percent to $266.3 million, 
and grow our global community 
of customers. As indicated in 
our introduction, Appian gained 
167 new clients in a highly 
challenging year.
